arts.ttl: Julen Lopetegui can't resist joke as West Ham boss responds to being suspended
arts.sum: Tomas Soucek and Aaron Wan-Bissaka scored the goals as the under-fire Hammers boss was handed a reprieve with a 2-0 win over dismal Newcastle on Monday night

arts.ttl: Newcastle United star to get instant recall after West Ham United disaster
arts.sum: Dan Burn is likely to walk straight back into Eddie Howe's XI against Crystal Palace this weekend following the poor defeat against West Ham. Speaking after the Premier League defeat to the Irons, Howe told Chronicle Live: "Yes, he was a big miss.

arts.ttl: Tuesday's Transfer Talk Update: Liam Delap, Viktor Gyokeres, Alexander Isak
arts.sum: Sports Mole rounds up the latest confirmed transfer news and speculation from across the footballing world.

arts.ttl: Newcastle United handed Marc Guehi transfer boost after contract talks suggestion
arts.sum: We Are Palace have reported that the Crystal Palace captain is holding out for Champions League football next season and is unwilling to commit his future to his current club. Newcastle United transfer target Marc Guehi has seen his talks with Crystal Palace over a new contract break down, fuelling talks over a potential January move.

arts.ttl: “One of the most promising” | West Ham eye one of the Premier League’s best young strikers
arts.sum: A young, highly rated, Premier League striker could be on his way to West Ham. Signing a No.9 who’s able to consistently score in claret and blue is something West Ham have struggled with for years. Both Gianluca Scamacca and Sebastian Haller were never able to prove themselves in England, while Danny Ings’ improved form... The post “One of the most promising” | West Ham eye one of the Premier League’s best young strikers appeared first on The West Ham Way.

arts.ttl: Howe: We were the dominant team at half-time
arts.sum: Despite the positives, Howe was left to rue the individual errors from his players in defence as Newcastle missed the chance to move into the top six, with his side now in 10th place. The Magpies head coach believed that Newcastle were the better team in the first half and said the final score would have been different had they converted one of their chances in that period.

arts.ttl: Bowen: The group we have is so good and there is a real togetherness
arts.sum: Jarrod Bowen praised the "togetherness" within West Ham United despite a tough start to the season as he reflected on the Hammers' impressive 2-0 victory over Newcastle United . It's down to me to show the new players what it means to play for this club," Bowen said to Sky Sports after the match.
